result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.
Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the children.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danny Vang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danny Vang in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant having pled guilty to an amended charge of Disorderly Conduct, parties are in court for sentencing.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the children.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Danny Vang in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 amended to "Disorderly Conduct", pursuant to Wisc. stats 947.01(1).
As to charge as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Jury trial date of 09/23/15 vacated.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed:
Justice Point Report.
cab

Defendant Danny Vang in court with attorney .  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM032244  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-05-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KOE M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Danny Vang in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Danny Vang in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
